metadata.policyTitle: Coverage Guidelines for Positive Airway Pressure (PAP) Devices

devicesIncluded.name: Bi-level Respiratory Assist Device without Backup Rate

coverageCriteria.description: Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) Device Coverage

criteria.A: Beneficiary has an in-person clinical evaluation by the treating practitioner prior to the sleep test to assess for obstructive sleep apnea.

B.description: Beneficiary has a sleep test that meets one of the following:

options.1: Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) or Respiratory Disturbance Index (RDI) ≥ 15 events per hour with a minimum of 30 events.

2.condition: AHI or RDI between 5 and 14 events per hour (minimum 10 events) with documentation of one or more of the following:

subconditions.a: Excessive daytime sleepiness, impaired cognition, mood disorders, or insomnia.
subconditions.b: Hypertension, ischemic heart disease, or history of stroke.

criteria.C: Beneficiary and/or caregiver has received instruction from the device supplier in proper use and care of the equipment.

coverageCriteria.nonComplianceNote: If a claim for an E0601 device is submitted and all criteria above have not been met, it will be denied as not reasonable and necessary.

coverageCriteria.description: Bi-level Respiratory Assist Device (without backup rate) Coverage

criteria.prerequisites: Beneficiary must meet all criteria A–C for E0601.
criteria.D: E0601 has been tried and proven ineffective based on a therapeutic trial conducted in a facility or home setting.

coverageCriteria.ineffectiveDefinition: Documented failure to meet therapeutic goals using E0601 during titration in a facility-based study or during home use despite optimal therapy (proper mask selection, fitting, and appropriate pressure settings).
